questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have an Azure subscription that contains a resource group named RG1. The role assignments for RG1 are shown in the following exhibit.

//IMG//


Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that completes each statement based on the information presented in the graphic.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: User 1 and User 3 : Backup contributor can manage backup services but can not create recovery service vault.

User2 May be able to create vault. I see contradicting information from microsoft sites. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/backup/backup-rbac-rs-vault

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/role-based-access-control/built-in-roles But User 1 with contributor role can definitely create recovery services vault. Only user access administrator or owner can assign the owner role. so user3 is correct
User with backup operator rol can´t create a recovery service vault, only user 1 with contributor rol can create it

comments.content:
Backup contributor role (user 2) can create recovery service vault: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/backup/backup-rbac-rs-vault

Provided answers looks correct.

Since we are looking for SAP hana system it should be sap-hana 
refer to "6. Customize an existing SUSE standard profile (sapconf)" in below link
https://blogs.sap.com/2017/12/22/prepare-your-linux-for-your-sap-solution-with-saptune/
also under "Sounds complicated? Maybe a little picture helps:" in below link 
https://www.suse.com/c/sapconf-a-way-to-prepare-a-sles-system-for-sap-workload-part-2/

discussion.content:
On exam dated 25.03.2021. Similar questions and options.
It had SLES 15 added as OS

comments.content: i think this comment must be for so,me other question)

discussion.content:
sapconf
sap-hana
because its talking about HLI

sapconf and sap-hana
Though sap-hana and sap-Netweaver are identical but the questions specifically mention HLI so more appropriate is 'sap-hana' option

/usr/lib/tuned/<profile>/tuned.com
<profile> is one of the profiles provided by sapconf
The profiles ‘sap-ase’ and ‘sap-bobj’ should not be used anymore!
Instead choose ‘sap-hana’ or ‘sap-netweaver’ which are identical.

questions.answer_description:
Box 1: sapconf -
The configuration is split into two parts:
/etc/sysconfig/sapconf
/usr/lib/tuned//tuned.conf

Box 2: tuned -
References:
https://www.suse.com/c/sapconf-a-way-to-prepare-a-sles-system-for-sap-workload-part-2/
questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are validating an SAP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) deployment.
You need to ensure that sapconf is installed and the kernel parameters are set appropriately for the active profile.
How should you complete the commands? To answer, drag the appropriate values to the correct targets. Each value may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

HOTSPOT
-

You have an SAP landscape on Azure.

You plan to deploy a new SAP application server by using an Azure Resource Manager template.

You need to ensure that all new servers are deployed with Azure Disk Encryption enabled.

How should you complete the relevant component of the template? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

To monitor the performance of the SAP NetWeaver environment by using Azure Extension for SAP, you should first install the Linux Diagnostic Extension using Azure CLI.

Therefore, the correct answer is: A. From Azure CLI, install the Linux Diagnostic Extension.

comments.content: OS is not specified, it may be Windows machine, then your answer can`t be correct.

discussion.content:
The correct answer is C. You must to perform action set before to enbale the extension. 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sap/workloads/vm-extension-for-sap-new#fa4428b9-bed6-459a-9dfb-74cc27454481

choices.D: From the Azure portal, enable the Azure Network Watcher Agent
choices.C: From Azure CLI, run the az vm aem set command
choices.B: From the Azure portal, enable the Custom Script Extension
choices.A: From Azure CLI, install the Linux Diagnostic Extension

questions.question_text:
You deploy an SAP environment on Azure.

You need to monitor the performance of the SAP NetWeaver environment by using Azure Extension for SAP.

What should you do first?

You have an Azure virtual machine that runs SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES). The virtual machine hosts a highly available deployment of SAP HANA.

You need to validate whether Accelerated Networking is operational for the virtual machine,

What should you use?
